```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(shiny)
library(flexdashboard)
library(tidyverse)
library(viridis)
library(plotly)
library(ggplot2)
library(leaflet)
library(DT)
library(dplyr)
```

```{r}
gun_df = read.csv("gun_df.csv") |>
  janitor::clean_names() |>
  mutate(
    date = as.Date(date, "%Y-%m-%d"),
    year = format(date, "%Y")
  )
```


Column {.sidebar}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

```{r}
selectInput(
  inputId = "state", 
  label = "Select State:", 
  choices = c("All", unique(gun_df$state)), 
  selected = "All"
)

sliderInput(
  inputId = "year", 
  label = "Select Year Range:", 
  min = 2018, 
  max = 2024, 
  value = c(2018, 2024), 
  step = 1, 
  sep = ""
)
```


Column {data-width=350}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Mass Shootings Map 

```{r}
renderLeaflet({
  filtered_data = gun_df |>
    filter(
      (input$state == "All" | state == input$state) &
      year >= input$year[1] &
      year <= input$year[2]
    )
  
  leaflet(filtered_data) |>
    addTiles() |>
    addCircleMarkers(
      lng = ~lng, lat = ~lat,  
      popup = ~paste0(
        "<b>", city, ", ", state, "</b><br>",
        "Date: ", date, "<br>",
        "Dead: ", dead, " Injured: ", injured, "<br>",
        "Description: ", description
      ),
      radius = ~total,
      color = ~ifelse(dead > 0, "red", "blue")
    )
})
```

### Top States by Incidents

```{r}
renderPlotly({
  top_n = ifelse(is.null(input$top_n), 5, as.integer(input$top_n))
  
  filtered_data = gun_df |>
    filter(year >= input$year[1] & year <= input$year[2]) |>
    group_by(state) |>
    summarise(total_incidents = n(), .groups = "drop") |>
    slice_max(order_by = total_incidents, n = top_n)
  
  plot_ly(
    data = filtered_data,
    x = ~reorder(state, total_incidents),
    y = ~total_incidents,
    type = "bar",
    text = ~state,
    marker = list(color = 'red')
  ) |>
    layout(
      xaxis = list(title = "State", tickangle = 45),  # Rotate labels
      yaxis = list(title = "Total Incidents"),
      title = "Top States by Gun Violence Incidents"
    )
})
```


Column {data-width=350}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Total Incidents by State

```{r}
renderPlotly({
  filtered_data = gun_df |>
    filter(
      (input$state == "All" | state == input$state) &
      year >= input$year[1] &
      year <= input$year[2]
    )
  
  plot = ggplot(filtered_data, aes(x = reorder(state, total), y = total)) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "steelblue") +
    labs(title = "Total Incidents by State", x = "State", y = "Total Incidents") +
    theme_minimal() +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))  
  
  ggplotly(plot)
})
```

### Gun Violence Data Table

```{r}
renderDT({
  filtered_data = gun_df |>
    filter(
      (input$state == "All" | state == input$state) &
      year >= input$year[1] &
      year <= input$year[2]
    ) |>
    select(-lat, -lng)  
  
  datatable(filtered_data, 
            options = list(pageLength = 20, scrollX = TRUE))
})
```
